content: silky soft scarf materials any yarn that you have on hand a stashbusting pattern if you want the scarf to be drapy go up 2 or by samantha stopple copyright 2008 more hooks sizes than the hook or needle size suggested on the ball band if you crochet loosely you might not need to if you crochet tightly like me you do the pattern foundation row chain to a length that looks good to you and add a few more chains just in case then w/o fastening off proceed to row 1 row 1 single_crochet ch1 in the 2nd chain from the hook skip the next chain single_crochet ch1 in the next chain across skip one more chain then end with a single_crochet when the length looks right to you pick out any extra chains not needed row 2 single_crochet in the first single_crochet single_crochet ch1 in the ch1 space of the previous row across ending with a example was made with frog tree pima single_crochet in the last ch1 space and a single_crochet in the last single_crochet cotton silk and a j / 6 0 mm hook approx 58 long and 3 wide row 3 single_crochet ch1 in the first single_crochet single_crochet ch1 in the gauge 12 row in 2 / 4 - single_crochet ch1 in 2 ch1 space of the previous row across end with a i did 17 row for my scarf single_crochet in the last single_crochet notes read before starting the pattern repeat row 2 and 3 until it s the width you want the foundation chain and first row are the same color yarn you do not turn your work you join at the beginning of each row and fasten_off at the end of each row the right side of the scarf is always facing you leave longish tails at the beginning and end of each row which will become part of the fringe no ends to weave in to get the look of this scarf you need to do add fringe to your liking trim if needed this even if you do this in one color give scarf a gentle blocking if needed
